presentation_notes.opening: Let me show you some real customer examples—what they were facing, how we solved it, and the results they got.

case_by_case.case_1: [Point to top card] Mid-market e-commerce company. 500 microservices. They were spending $1.2M annually on Snowflake. 70% of their ingested data was never queried—just exploratory datasets polluting production tables. [Point to solution] We deployed Expanso agents at their API gateway and database change streams. Filtered exploratory data to S3 cold storage at $0.02 per gigabyte. Routed only production-critical data to Snowflake. [Point to results] 68% cost reduction—$816K in annual savings. Took 3 weeks from shadow mode to production. Payback in 2.5 months. Plus their data quality improved—cleaner production tables. [Point to quote] Their VP of Data Engineering said: 'Expanso paid for itself in 10 weeks. We're now using those savings to fund our ML initiatives.'
case_by_case.case_2: [Point to middle card] Enterprise logistics provider. 5,000+ IoT devices generating 200 terabytes per month. Spending $2.8M annually on Splunk and Datadog for IoT telemetry. Most of it was diagnostic noise only needed for debugging. Compliance required 7-day retention but only 1% was ever accessed. [Point to solution] We deployed Expanso at their edge gateways. Filtered diagnostic logs in real-time. Routed only anomalies and errors to Splunk and Datadog. Archived full logs to S3 for compliance. [Point to results] 72% cost reduction—$2.02M in annual savings. 65% reduction in network bandwidth and egress costs. 40% reduction in mean time to recovery because less noise means faster debugging. And compliance was maintained with full 7-day archive in S3. [Point to quote] Their Director of Infrastructure said: 'We saved $2M and our SREs are happier because they're not drowning in logs anymore.'
case_by_case.case_3: [Point to bottom card] FinTech startup. 50 terabytes per month with rapid growth. Databricks costs were doubling every 6 months. ML training data included full transaction histories but only recent patterns were relevant. Plus PII concerns in development environments. [Point to solution] We deployed Expanso at the data ingestion layer. Time-windowed filtering—last 90 days for ML. Masked PII before Databricks ingestion. Routed full transaction history to S3 for compliance. [Point to results] 58% cost reduction—$480K in annual savings. 35% reduction in model training time because of smaller, cleaner datasets. Improved PII compliance by masking before the cloud. And now their costs are predictable—future-proof scaling. [Point to quote] Their CTO and co-founder said: 'Expanso let us scale our ML platform without the infrastructure costs eating our runway.'

presentation_notes.pattern_recognition: Notice the pattern: Different industries, different platforms, different data types. But the same 50-70% reduction. That's what upstream data control delivers.
